author: tbenr
content:
<@607055410104500244> <@491624610215886849> how long the rate limit ban persists until the peer can try again?
which rate are you permitting atm, on blobs and blocks?

author: pawandhananjay
content:
if you get banned at the libp2p level, then the ban lasts for 10 mins.
If you exceed the rate limit, you get dowscored a bit and we send back an rpc error response which tells you number of ms you need to wait before sending us a new request.
<@412614104222531604> i think for the purposes of the devnet, we can disable inbound rate limiting on lighthouse using the `--inbound-rate-limiter disabled` flag.

author: pawandhananjay
content: currently, we allow 768 blobs by range requests every 10secs, 1024 blocks by range every 10secs

author: barnabasbusa
content: I have now disabled the inbound rate limiter on all the lighthouse nodes.

author: tbenr
content: seems pretty high, we shouldn't reach that limit..
